name: Sudan
introduction: Military regimes favoring Islamic-oriented governments have dominated national politics since independence from Anglo-Egyptian co rule in 1956. Sudan was embroiled in two prolonged civil wars during most of the remainder of the 20th century. These conflicts were rooted in northern economic political and social domination of largely non-Muslim non-Arab southern Sudanese. The first civil war ended in 1972 but another broke out in 1983. Peace talks gained momentum in 2002-04 with the signing of several accords. The final North/South Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) signed in January 2005 granted the southern rebels autonomy for six years followed by a referendum on independence for Southern Sudan. The referendum was held in January 2011 and indicated overwhelming support for independence. South Sudan became independent on 9 July 2011. Sudan and South Sudan have yet to fully implement security and economic agreements signed on September 27 2012 relating to the normalization of relations between the two countries. The final disposition of the contested Abyei region has also to be decided. Since South Sudan's independence conflict has broken out between the government and the Sudan People's Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) in Southern Kordofan and Blue Nile states which has resulted in 1.2 million internally displaced persons or severely affected persons in need of humanitarian assistance. A separate conflict which broke out in the western region of Darfur in 2003 has displaced nearly two million people and caused an estimated 200000 to 400000 deaths. Violence in Darfur in 2013 resulted in an additional estimated 6000 civilians killed and 500000 displaced. The UN and the African Union have jointly commanded a Darfur peacekeeping operation known as the African Union-United Nations Hybrid Mission in Darfur (UNAMID) since 2007. Peacekeeping troops have struggled to stabilize the situation and have increasingly become targets for attacks by armed groups. In 2013 16 peacekeepers were killed UNAMID's deadliest year so far. Sudan also has faced refugee influxes from neighboring countries primarily Ethiopia Eritrea Chad Central African Republic and South Sudan. Armed conflict poor transport infrastructure and government denial of access have impeded the provision of humanitarian assistance to affected populations.
overview: 'The Sudan or Sudan also known as North Sudan since South Sudan''s independence and officially the Republic of the Sudan is a country in Northeast Africa.'

languages.name: Acoli
languages.area: North, Kitgum District; Adjumani and Pader districts. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Ta'izzi-Adeni Arabic
languages.area: All provinces except the 2 east and the northeast ones. Probably a few in United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia. Also in Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Kenya, Libya, Somalia, United Kingdom.

languages.name: Hijazi Arabic
languages.area: Red Sea coast and adjacent highlands. Also in Eritrea.

languages.name: Acheron
languages.area: North, Southern Kordofan Province, Moro Hills.

languages.name: Afitti
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, east Jebel ed Dair. Main center is Sidra.

languages.name: Aja (South Sudan)
languages.area: South, Western Bahr el Ghazal Province.

languages.name: Amharic
languages.area: North central, Amhara region; Addis Ababa. Also in Djibouti, Egypt, Israel, Sweden, United States.

languages.name: Amdang
languages.area: Wadi Fira region, Biltine Departement, Biltine Sous-Préfecture, Mimi Goz and Mimi Hadjer cantons north of Biltine; Batha region; Ouaddaï region.

languages.name: Anuak
languages.area: Upper Nile Province, Pibor and Lower Akobo rivers. From Akobo Post to latitude 6.45N. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: Sudanese Arabic
languages.area: Primarily north. Also in Egypt, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Libya, Saudi Arabia.

languages.name: Arabic
languages.area: Middle East, North Africa. Also in Algeria, Bahrain, Chad, Comoros, Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Oman, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Qatar, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Tanzania, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen.

languages.name: Algerian Arabic
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: Also in Belgium, Egypt, France, Germany, Saint Pierre and Miquelon.

languages.name: Moroccan Arabic
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: North, south of Atlas Mountains, including Sahara port cities. Also in Belgium, Egypt, France, Germany, Gibraltar, Libya, Netherlands, United Kingdom, Western Sahara.

languages.name: Egyptian Arabic
languages.area: Also in Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Libya, Saudi Arabia, Syria, United Arab Emirates, Yemen.

languages.name: Reel
languages.area: South, Lakes Province; border Ciec Dinka [dib] north near Panekar; Agar Dinka [dib] west near Lake Nyibor; Jur Modo [bex] south; and Ador Dinka [dib] east near Yirol.

languages.name: Avokaya
languages.area: South, Western Equatorial Province. Ajugu is on Sudan-Congo border south of Maridi; Ojila mainly between Naam (Era) and Olo rivers and east. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: West Central Banda
languages.area: Bambari, Bakala (Dakpa), Grimari (Gbi, Wojo), Kaga Bandoro (Wojo), Bamingui (Gbaga-Nord) subprefectures. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Baka (South Sudan)
languages.area: South, Western Equatoria Province, south and west of Maridi, northwest of Yei. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Burun
languages.area: North, Blue Nile Province.

languages.name: Bai (South Sudan)
languages.area: South, Western District, Wau-Deim Zubeir road, west of Sere. Some north of Tembura. 2 villages.

languages.name: Beja
languages.area: Northeast along Red Sea coast. Also in Egypt, Eritrea.

languages.name: Jur Modo
languages.area: South, Mvolo area; Naam (Olo) River.

languages.name: Bari
languages.area: South, both banks of the Nile, south of Terakeka on west bank, south of Mongalla on east bank, as far as Kajo Kaji Escarpment. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: Banda-Ndélé
languages.area: Ndili, Bamingui, Ouadda, Kaga Bandoro subprefectures. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Mid-Southern Banda
languages.area: Alindao, Mobaye, Mingala, Kembe, Kouango subprefectures. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Sudan.

languages.name: Beli (South Sudan)
languages.area: South, southwest of Rumbek, Wulu, Bahr Gel road west, south toward Lakes Province south border; east of Mvolo with no links to those at Wulu. Bahri Girinti (Lake Nyiropo) is center, just west of Yei River. Some heavily intermingled with Dinka.

languages.name: Bongo
languages.area: Sparsely populated from Tonj and Wau north, Beli [blm] east, Zande [zne] south, and Bor [dks] west.

languages.name: Banda-Banda
languages.area: Bria (Bereya), Yalinga (Vidiri), Bakouma, Sibut (Ka, Gbaga-South), Dekoa, Damara, Grimari (Mbi), Bossangoa (Gbambiya), Bozoum, Bocarangoa, Paoua (Hai) subprefectures. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Banda-Mbrès
languages.area: Mbrès Subprefecture (Mbre, Moruba), Kaga Bandoro, Bouca (Buka), Bakala (Sabanga, Moruba). Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Boguru
languages.area: Mariko, Baambu, Ibba, Bagasu. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Birked
languages.area: North, north Darfur, north and east of Daju and Baygo, east of Jebel Marra between Jebel Harayt and Rizaykat (Arab) country; north of Nyala; north Kordofan south of El Obeid.

languages.name: Belanda Viri
languages.area: South, scattered villages (Bringi, Bagari, Dadu, Ngoku, Ngisa, Farajallah, Ngotakala, Ngongba, Natabo, Momoyi, and some others), Raffili area; on Wau road; on Kuru River, 65 km from Deim Zubeir; Tembura area among Zande [zne]; Iba River near Yambio.

languages.name: Belanda Bor
languages.area: South between Wau and Tambura; Bahr-el-Ghazal in Raffili, Tirga, Bazia, Ayo, Gitten, and Taban villages; Western Equatoria Province, Komai, Nagero, Bangazegino, and Tambura villages.

languages.name: Baygo
languages.area: North, Southern Darfur, southeast of Nyala, hills east of Kube (Kubbi), Jebel Beygo.

languages.name: Berti
languages.area: North, Tagabo Hills, Darfur, and Kordofan.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Dar Fur Daju
languages.area: North, Dar Fur Province, Daju Hills 40 km northeast of Nyala; Geneina District in Dar Masalit. West Kordofan dialect in Daju Hills near Lagowa, main settlements at Dar el Kabira (Kidong), Silecce, and Warina; Jebel Miheila, Nyukri, and Tamanyik.

languages.name: Dar Sila Daju
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Sila Department; Goz-Beïda area and east to Sudan border; Salamat region, Barh Azoum Department, camps of internally displaced people. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Dongotono
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, Dongotono Hills southeast of Torit.

languages.name: Dagik
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains; Mesakin Hills, Reika village.

languages.name: South Central Dinka
languages.area: South, west of the Nile, south of the Sudd. Aker is southeast of Agar; Aliap south of Bor [dks] in fishing villages mainly on Nile east bank; Ciec in Lakes District on Nile west bank; Gok between Agar and Rek [dik] in Jur River and Lakes districts.

languages.name: Didinga
languages.area: South, Didinga Hills (60 km northeast of Sudan, Kenya and Uganda borders); north of Nagishot.

languages.name: Southwestern Dinka
languages.area: South, north and northwest of Wau.

languages.name: Dilling
languages.area: North, Southern Kordofan, Dilling town and surrounding hills, including Kudur.

languages.name: Northeastern Dinka
languages.area: South, northeast of the Sudd, both sides of White Nile, along Sobat River.

languages.name: Northwestern Dinka
languages.area: South, north of Bahr el Ghazal River; south Kordofan, Abyei area.

languages.name: Southeastern Dinka
languages.area: South, east of the Nile, Bor [dks] area, and north. Also in Canada.

languages.name: Dair
languages.area: North, west and south Jebel Dair, Kordofan.

languages.name: El Hugeirat
languages.area: North, West Kordofan, El Hugeirat Hills, Sija, Bija, Shenshin, Baboy villages.

languages.name: Nding
languages.area: North, south Eliri range.

languages.name: Feroge
languages.area: South, Western Bahr el Ghazal at Khor Shamam, northeast of Raga.

languages.name: Nobiin
languages.area: Northern Province, north from Burgeg to Egypt border at Wadi Halfa; Kassala Province, New Halfa. Also in Egypt.

languages.name: Adamawa Fulfulde
languages.area: Widespead in Far North, North and Adamawa provinces. Also in Chad, Nigeria, Sudan, United States.

languages.name: Ko
languages.area: North, extreme east Nuba hills, isolated hills between Talodi and the White Nile.

languages.name: Fur
languages.area: North, Darfur; east. Also in Chad.

languages.name: West Central Oromo
languages.area: West and central, Oromo region; Rift Valley escarpment east of Dessie and Woldiya. Also in Egypt.

languages.name: Mo'da
languages.area: South, northwest of Mvolo, Lakes and Western Equatoria provinces border, both sides.

languages.name: Ghulfan
languages.area: North, Kordofan, 2 hills 45 km south of Dilling: Ghulfan Kurgul and Ghulfan Morung. villages: Tarda, Ninya, Kurgul, Moring, Dabri, Katang, Shigda, Karkandi, Ota, Namang.

languages.name: Gule
languages.area: North, Jebel Gule, San and Roro hills north of the Gaam, west of Er Roseires.

languages.name: Gumuz
languages.area: Metemma area on Sudan border south through Gondar and Gojjam; along Blue Nile and south into Wellaga and Didessa Valley up to Leqemt-Gimbi Road; southwest of Addis Ababa, villages around Welqite (possibly 1,000). Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Northwest Gbaya
languages.area: Bouar, Baboua, Bocaranga, Paoua subprefectures. Also in Cameroon, Congo, Nigeria.

languages.name: Ganza
languages.area: South of Yabus Bridge, along Sudan border.

languages.name: Hausa
languages.area: Sokoto, Kaduna, Katsina, Kano, Bauchi, Jigawa, Zamfara, Kebbi, and Gombe states. Spoken as L2 in north. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Congo, Eritrea, Germany, Ghana, Niger, Sudan, Togo.

languages.name: Heiban
languages.area: North, Heiban area, Abul (Obul), and nearby hills; Abri-Talodi road, Heiban town.

languages.name: Homa
languages.area: South, Mopoi and Tambura towns.

languages.name: Indri
languages.area: South, southwest in Raga area.

languages.name: Ngile
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains, Mesakin Hills, outlying hills.

languages.name: Jumjum
languages.area: North Upper Nile Province, along Khor Jumjum: Jebels Tunga, Terta, and Wadega.

languages.name: Keliko
languages.area: South, south Yei District. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Uganda.

languages.name: Gula (Central African Republic)
languages.area: Birao Subprefecture, Kafia Kingi near Sudan border. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Kanga
languages.area: North, Miri Hills, west and southwest of Kadugli. Kufa village cluster southeast of Miri, northeast of Lima, and north of Kanga. 4 main villages in Kufa: Toole, Lenyaguyox, Bilenya, and Dologi; Toole main center. Lima in villages Lima, Kilag, and Mashaish, 15 km west of Kadugli.

languages.name: Katla
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Katla Hills 55 km southwest of Dilling. Katla in Bombori, Kateik, Kiddu, Kirkpong, Karoka, Koldrong; Julud in Karkarya, Karkando, Kolbi, Kambai, Rumber, Octiang, Sabba, Tolot, Kary, Kitanngo, Kimndang, Kabog, Koto Kork, Kabosh, Kabog North.

languages.name: Kadaru
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba mountains, Kadaru Hills (known as ‘Jibaal as Sitta’) between Dilling and Delami.

languages.name: Keiga
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Jebel Demik, north of Miri; west Kadugli Province, 3 areas: Ambong (villages: Ambong, Ambongadi, Kandang, Kuluwaring, Tingiragadi, Lakkadi, Taffor, Arungekkaadi, Bila Ndulang, Roofik, Saadhing); Lubung (villages: Kuwaik, Tungunungunu, Miya Ntaarang, Miya Ntaluwa, Miya Ndumuru, Semalili); Tumuro (villages: Koolo, Kayide, Jughuba, Tumuro).

languages.name: Tese
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Keiga Jirru west of Debri; 6 villages northeast of Kadugli.

languages.name: Kakwa
languages.area: Northwest corner, West Nile District. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Sudan.

languages.name: Krongo
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Krongo Hills, south of Masakin range and west of Talodi. Mainly in Tabanya, Toroji and Angolo, and also in Damaguto, Dimadragu, Dimodongo, and Dar.

languages.name: Koalib
languages.area: North, south Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains, around Delami, including Umm Berumbita and Turum (Nguqwurang), south and southwest of Abri around Koalib range (Ngunduna), Nyukwur area; Umm Heitan and Hadra (Nginyukwur), Abri (Ngirere) plain area villages.

languages.name: Karko
languages.area: North, Karko Hills, Kordofan, 35 km west of Dilling, including Dulman.

languages.name: Komo (Democratic Republic of Congo)
languages.area: Maniema Province, into Former Orientale and Nord-Kivu provinces to Walikale, Opienge, and Punia. Lubutu is center.

languages.name: Central Kanuri
languages.area: Borno state, Kukawa, Kaga, Konduga, Maiduguri, Monguno, Ngala, Bama, Gwoza LGAs; Yobe state, Nguru, Geidam, Damaturu, Fika, Fune, and Gujba LGAs; Jigawa state, Hadejia LGA. Also in Cameroon, Chad, Eritrea, Niger, Sudan.

languages.name: Kacipo-Balesi
languages.area: South, Boma Plateau, near Ethiopia border. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Gbaya (Sudan)
languages.area: South, western Bahr el Ghazal Province, Kuru, Deim Zubeir, Raga, Angbanga, Kata, Menangba, Boro, Kafia Kingi. Dongo reportedly in south Darfur Province, Hobbinya District, Wau and Khartoum. Most in Raga and Boro. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Kunama
languages.area: West, Gash and Setit rivers, Sudan border and into Tigray Province. Barka south of Barentu; Marda north, northeast, and east of Barentu and in Barentu; Aimara west of Barentu; Laki-Tukura south of Aimara, west of Barka; Tika south of Laki-Tukura, west of Barka. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Lafofa
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Central Eliri Range; 2 hills south and east.

languages.name: T'apo
languages.area: Gambella region, along Sudan border north of Anuak [anu] and Nuer [nus]. 5 villages. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Logorik
languages.area: North, central Nuba Mountains, Jebel Liguri hills area northeast of Kadugli.

languages.name: Päri
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, Jebel Lafon, Bura, Pucwaa, Pugari, Kor, Angulumeere, and Wiatuo villages, northwest of Lopit [lpx], northeast of Lokoya [lky].

languages.name: Lokoya
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, Torit District.

languages.name: Lumun
languages.area: North, Talodi, Moro Hills; Toromathan, To’ri, and Canya’ru villages.

languages.name: Lango (South Sudan)
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, Ikotos area, between Kidepo and Logoforok villages.

languages.name: Logol
languages.area: North, extreme east Nuba Hills, isolated hills between Talodi and the White Nile.

languages.name: Narim
languages.area: South, west Boya Hills, Mt. Kosodek and Mt. Lobuli areas.

languages.name: Otuho
languages.area: South, Torit District, Eastern Equatoria Province, east and southeast of Olubo [lul] and Lokoya [lky].

languages.name: Lopit
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, Lopit Hills, northeast of Torit.

languages.name: Laro
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Laro (Alleira) hills area, Oya, Rodong (Hajar Medani), Hajar Baco, Gunisaia, Serif, Tondly, Reli, Lagau (Serfinila), Getaw (Hajar Tiya), Orme (Ando) villages.

languages.name: Olu'bo
languages.area: South, Eastern Equatoria Province, 50 km east of Nile River. Main town is Lokiliri, between Juba-Torit and Juba-Nimule roads.

languages.name: Luwo
languages.area: South, Bahr el Ghazal, north of Wau toward Aweil, southeast of Wau to Tonj.

languages.name: Maba (Chad)
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Ouara and Djourf-al-Ahmar departments and Wadi Fira region, Biltine Department, Biltine Subprefecture; most of Ouara Department and villages south of Biltine.

languages.name: Midob
languages.area: North, Darfur Province, Jebel Midob, and settled communities in Omdurman and Gezira Aba. The center is Malha.

languages.name: Mabaan
languages.area: Blue Nile and Upper Nile provinces border, between Yabus and Tombak rivers north and Khor Daga south.

languages.name: Mararit
languages.area: Wadi Fira region, Biltine Department, Am Zoer Subprefecture (Abou Charib), and Ouaddaï region, Assoungha Department, Mabrone Subprefecture (Mararit).

languages.name: Morokodo
languages.area: South, between Amadi and Maridi.

languages.name: Moru
languages.area: South, Equatoria Province, Mundri District.

languages.name: Ma'di
languages.area: North, Moyo and Adjumani districts, West Nile District near Nimule, north Sudan border. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Moro
languages.area: North, east Nuba Mountains, Kordofan Province.

languages.name: Mandari
languages.area: South, north of Bari, Taliarea; both sides of the Nile between Tombe and Mongalla.

languages.name: Mündü
languages.area: South, Western Equatoria Province, northwest of Yei, south of Maridi. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Murle
languages.area: South, Upper Nile Province, Pibor District, south of Akobo River, Boma Plateau, and east and north. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Mittu
languages.area: South.

languages.name: Mangayat
languages.area: South, West Bahr el Ghazal, Mangayat, 30 km southeast of Raga; some in Raga.

languages.name: Me'en
languages.area: Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Regional State, Bench-Maji zone. Highlanders (Banio) in Bachuma area; lowlanders (Koruwo) south; Bodi near Omo River.

languages.name: Ndogo
languages.area: South, Western District, Wau-Deim Zubeir Road between Mboro and Kpango rivers; a few north of Tembura among Zande [zne].

languages.name: Njalgulgule
languages.area: South, Sopo River just above Sopo-Boro confluence; west of the Dinka. 1 village.

languages.name: Nuer
languages.area: South, east Upper Nile Province, upper Sobat River, Nasir, a triangle area formed between Bahr el Zeraf and Bahr el Jebel, up Sobat River across the Ethiopia border. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Nyamusa-Molo
languages.area: South, Western Equatoria Province, southeast of Beli, northeast of Morokodo.

languages.name: Ama (Sudan)
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, northwest of Dilling in hills of which Jebel Nyimang is part; Mandal (Male) range. Some villages: Kalara, Koromiti, Nitil, Al Fous, Kakara, Hajar Sultan, Salara, Tundia, Fuony (Funda).

languages.name: Otoro
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains region, Otoro Hills south of Heiban and west of Heiban-Talodi road.

languages.name: Sudanese Creole Arabic
languages.area: South, widespread in Equatoria region, into Bahr al Ghazal and Upper Nile regions. Refugees have gone to other countries.

languages.name: Tegali
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains, Tegali Range, Rashad hills and Rashad town.

languages.name: Domari
languages.area: Kurbat and Luli in west; Mehtar in Fars and Kohgiluyeh va Boyerahmad Province; Karachi in north. Also in Afghanistan, Egypt, India, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Libya, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Russian Federation (Europe), Sudan, Syria, Turkey (Europe), Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Ngambay
languages.area: Logone Occidental region; Logone Oriental region, Lanya Department (Bébedjia), La Nya Pendé Department, Goré Subprefecture; Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah Department. Centered in Moundou area. Also in Cameroon, Nigeria.

languages.name: Shatt
languages.area: North, Shatt Hills southwest of Kadugli (Shatt Daman, Shatt Safia, Shatt Tebeldia); Abu Hashim and Abu Sinam areas.

languages.name: Shilluk
languages.area: South, Upper Nile Province, between Nile and Kordofan Province boundary, 130 km west of Tonga; Nile east bank, Nile and Sobat River junction area, and 35 km up Sobat River.

languages.name: Shwai
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains, Shwai Hills villages, northwest of Otoro near Heiban-Kadugli road.

languages.name: Assangori
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Assoungha Department, northwest of Adré and of the Masalit [mls].

languages.name: Aka
languages.area: North, Sillok (Silak) Hills, west of Berta-speaking [wti] people.

languages.name: Sokoro
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, north and northwest of Melfi, Gogmi to Badanga.

languages.name: Somali
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Canada, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Finland, Italy, Kenya, Oman, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, Yemen.

languages.name: Suri
languages.area: Southwest Kafa region toward Sudan border; west of Mizan Teferi. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Swahili (Coastal)
languages.area: Zanzibar, coastal areas. Also in Burundi, Canada, Kenya, Libya, Mayotte, Mozambique, Oman, Rwanda, Somalia, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United States.

languages.name: Sinyar
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Sila Department, north of Mongororo, near confluence of Kaja, Azum, and Salih rivers. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Tagoi
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, Nuba Mountains, Moreb, Tagoi, Turjok, Tumale Hill, possibly Tuling village. Tagoi in Tukum and Turum (1956 Tucker and Bryan).

languages.name: Tocho
languages.area: North, Talodi, Moro Hills.

languages.name: Gaam
languages.area: North, Tabi Massif and area hills, Jebel Tabi area; a few in Khartoum.

languages.name: Tumtum
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills; Kurondi south of Eliri; Eliri area north, Talassa.

languages.name: Temein
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Temein hills southwest of Dilling, between Jebels Ghulfan Morung and Julud (Gulud), Tukur, Nekring, Kwiye, Tokoing, Tulu, Farik, Kuris villages.

languages.name: Tennet
languages.area: South, Equatoria Province, Lopit Hills, northeast of Torit. 5 villages.

languages.name: Tulishi
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills west edge hills, Jebel Tulishi south of Katla; Jebel Kamdang north of Lagowa, south of Tulishi, Laati, Lawwa, Ntukungnge, Aabiisa, Nattilongke, Aliyooro Manadaha, Thudhi, Kirakaati vilages. Lagawa largest village, Kam’da administrative center.

languages.name: Togoyo
languages.area: South, west, Raga, small area.

languages.name: Thuri
languages.area: South, between Wau and Aweil, between Jur and Lol rivers, Raga-Nyamlell and Wau-Deim Zubeir roads.

languages.name: Tigre
languages.area: Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Tigrinya
languages.area: Tigray Province. Also in Canada, Djibouti, Eritrea, Germany, Israel.

languages.name: Talodi
languages.area: North, Nuba Hills, Talodi town and hill, Tasomi and Tata villages.

languages.name: Tama (Chad)
languages.area: East, Biltine Prefecture, Guéréda Subprefecture, Guéréda area. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Tima
languages.area: North, West Kordofan District, Nuba Hills, Jebel Tima area villages, 15 km southwest of Katla.

languages.name: Toposa
languages.area: South, Singaita and Lokalyen rivers’ sides. Ritual center at Loyooro River. Migrate to Moruangipi, and farther east for seasonal grazing into Ilemi Triangle at Ethiopia border, but no permanent settlements there.

languages.name: Togbo-Vara Banda
languages.area: Equateur Province, Nord Ubangi, Bosobolo Territory, Badja and Baya town areas, Vongba II and Bandema village areas, on the road as far as Gwara II, and scattered nearby. Also in Central African Republic, Sudan.

languages.name: Torona
languages.area: North, Talodi, Moro Hills.

languages.name: Tedaga
languages.area: Far north desert, Borkou-Ennedi-Tibesti region, Tibesti Department, Bardai area. Also in Libya, Niger, Nigeria.

languages.name: Turkish
languages.area: Widespread in Turkey as L1 or L2. Also in Australia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Egypt, El Salvador, Finland, France, Georgia, Germany, Greece, Honduras, Iran, Iraq, Israel, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Macedonia, Netherlands, Romania, Russian Federation (Asia), Serbia, Sweden, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Uduk
languages.area: Gambela region, near Gambela town, Bonga, large refugee camp. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Wali (Sudan)
languages.area: North, Wali Hills, south of Karko Hills.

languages.name: Wali (Ghana)
languages.area: Northwest corner.

languages.name: Warnang
languages.area: North, far east Nuba Hills, isolated hills, between Talodi and the White Nile.

languages.name: Berta
languages.area: Beni Shangul region, corner formed by Blue Nile River and Sudan border north of Asosa; Dalati, Sirba Abay area east of Dabus River. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Kelo
languages.area: North, Tornasi Hills, Jebels Tornasi (Keeli village) and Beni Sheko. West of Berta [wti].

languages.name: Komo (Sudan)
languages.area: North, Ahmar, Tombak, and Yabus rivers; Blue Nile Province, south Funj region. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Katcha-Kadugli-Miri
languages.area: North, Kordofan Province, hills south of Nuba Hills. Katcha is in Katcha, Tuna, Kafina, Dabakaya (Donga), Belanya and Farouq villages, south of Kadugli and southeast of the Miri Hills; Kadugli in villages surrounding Kadugli, namely, Murta, Kulba, ’Daalimo, Thappare and Takko; Miri in Miri Bara, Miri Guwa, Umduiu, Nyimodu, Luba, Kadoda, Kya, Tulluk, Hayar al-Nimr, Kuduru, Kasari and Sogolle villages which lie west of Kadugli.

languages.name: Yulu
languages.area: Ouadda-Djaléi and Ouadda subprefectures. Yulu are in Central African Republic and Sudan; Binga are in Sudan and Democratic Republic of the Congo. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Sudan.

languages.name: Zaghawa
languages.area: North, northwest Dar Fur, and scattered south; Kordofan. Also in Chad, Libya.

languages.name: Molo
languages.area: Jebel Malkan, near the Berta, south of the Blue Nile, near Ethiopia border.

languages.name: Zande
languages.area: Far north of Orientale Province, Bas-Uele District. Also in Central African Republic, Sudan.
